fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Immediately after creating a Sprint, in a sufficiently complex Jira instance, if the Sprint is started then the page will continually load until it times out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Environment:  
 \- A board that has over 20 issues in the backlog in a complex Jira instance

Steps to reproduce:
 \- Create a new sprint
 \- Bulk ranking 20 issues from the backlog to the newly created sprint
 \- Note that the Create Sprint button is enabled
 \- Start the sprint right away

h3. Expected Results

The confirmation page is displayed and the sprint can be started.

h3. Actual Results

Jira processes the ranking in the backend, and no issues are added to the sprint right away. If a user tries to start that sprint, a timeout error is displayed after a couple of minutes.

h3. Workaround

After a sprint is created, wait for some period of time -- anywhere from 10 to 30 minutes -- before starting the sprint.
fields.summary: Starting a sprint immediately after creating it times out due to bulk ranking performance in complex Jira instances

fields.description:
Hello!

We would like to suggest Atlassian look into the possibility a gateway for the Data Center products.

The use case for such a solution is to allow Atlassian Data Center customers to collaborate with external parties w/o the need to comprise their security posture by hosting Atlassian applications in a DMZ.

By gateway, we mean an Atlassian-aware forward and reverse proxy server.

Here is our idea for how such a gateway would work:
h3. Start-up:
 # The internally-hosted application (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Bamboo) creates an outbound connection to the DMZ-hosted gateway application. This connection is used as a control channel for passing data between the two applications.
 ## The control channel provides proxy details (IP address and port mappings) to the gateway.
 ## The gateway starts up listeners on the designated IPs and ports for incoming traffic.

h3. Reverse proxy mode:
 # When an external application connects to a listener on the DMZ-hosted gateway, the gateway makes a request over the control channel to the application in the internal network.
 # The internally-hosted application then creates a new outbound data channel to the gateway.
 ## This data channel is attached to service (e.g. HTTP/s) and all traffic for that session is routed over this data channel.
 ## When the session is terminated, the corresponding data channel is removed.

h3. Forward proxy mode:
 # When the internally-hosted application needs to make an outbound connection, a request is made to gateway with the address of the intended destination.
 # The gateway establishes the connection to the destination and bridges it to the requesting application.
 ## The bridge does not reveal the identity or locations of the internal systems.

Regards,

-CET
fields.summary: 'Atlassian Gateway' for Data Center products

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a workflow, if we edit a status, this change applies immediately. It doesn't wait for the workflow to be published.

This happens by design, because statuses are independent of workflows, but the interface is misleading and only allows Status editing when we start editing the Workflow.

Suggestion: either have the dialog make it clear that the change is applied immediately.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Workflow, in the Diagram view;
 # Click Edit, to start editing the Workflow;
 # Click on a status and click the Edit button
 # Change the Status name and save.

h3. Expected Results

Have the status changed only when the workflow is published
h3. Actual Results

The change is applied immediately.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

As a mitigation factor, enable the Advanced auditing for the "Global configuration and administration" category, to have the status changes recorded.
fields.summary: Editing an workflow status without publishing it applies the status change

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There were changes to the functionalities revolving around the Velocity Cache. Upon discussion with the development team, we uncovered that the team was not able to control velocity cache invalidation manually, so they changed its flushing interval to something around 5 minutes.

This operation did not have a significant performance impact but allowed users to go back to the default templates without restarting Jira (and make changes to the same templates without restarting the application as well, as a side-effect).

The team mentioned that the part of our documentation that mentions risk should be altered, provided that the articles refer to the versions where the features were altered.

In this case, we are referring to the following message, located at the end of the *Optional: Deploying Velocity templates without restarting Jira* section:

{quote}
Making this change in production will eventually lead to Jira not serving pages along with the 'ran out of parsers' error in the log file.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the [Customizing email content in Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0816/customizing-email-content-in-jira-server-1063164918.html] article.

h3. Expected Results
* Not applicable.

h3. Actual Results
* Not applicable.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Documentation article - Customizing email content in Jira Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira When the user tries to customise the time constraints in jira-config.properties "Created Vs Resolved" chart still takes the default value from jpm.xml.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1.Stop the jira server 
 2.Add the below time constraints in the jira-config.properties file under JIRA_HOME .
{panel:bgColor=#eef7f6}
jira.chart.days.previous.limit.yearly=90
 jira.chart.days.previous.limit.quarterly=90
 jira.chart.days.previous.limit.monthly=90
 jira.chart.days.previous.limit.weekly=90
 jira.chart.days.previous.limit.daily=90
 jira.chart.days.previous.limit.hourly=10
{panel}
3.Start the jira server.
 4.Add the gadget “Created vs. Resolved chart”.
h3. Expected Results

For Days Previously tab Exception should be thrown when the value provided exceeds as defined in the jira-config.properties.
h3. Actual Results

For Days Previously tab Exception is thrown only if we exceed the default 300 days *"Maximum allowed value is 300 days"* for the 'Daily' period.
 Other gadgets works with the value provided in the jira-config.properties where the exception is thrown when the value provided is higher than that defined one in the jira-config.properties *"Days must not exceed 90 for daily period".*

 !Screenshot 2021-09-17 at 4.49.52 PM-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2021-09-17 at 4.57.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Changing the constraints on historical time parameters is not reflecting in the Created vs. Resolved chart

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have three different sprints A (100), B (101), and C (102) in that sequence and I reopen sprint 101, after closing it these three sprints will be displayed in a different order.

The documentation of the methods responsible for selecting the order of sprints states:
{quote}
The list of sprints returned will be ordered by state in the following order (closed, active, future) and sprint sequence in ascending order.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create sprint A and close it.
 # Create sprint B and close it.
 # Create sprint C and close it.
 # Reopen sprint B and close it again.

h3. Expected Results

* Agile reports, such as the velocity report will display these sprints in the following order A, B, C.

h3. Actual Results

* The sprints are displayed in the following order: A, C, B.

 !Screen Shot 2021-09-17 at 10.12.04.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Reopening a sprint and closing it alters the order that sprints are displayed in Agile Reports

fields.description:
The documentation [Configuring an announcement banner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/configuring-an-announcement-banner-1027137639.html] states that the permission for configuring the Jira announcement banner is *Jira Administrators* when, in fact, the required one is *Jira System Administrators.*

Amplifying the reach of this FR, there are many documents that should get updated.

By default, Jira does not create a Jira-System-Administrator group, just the Jira-Administrator one with total access. Then the admins tend to segment the administration roles to have different levels for safety and best practices. So if Jira Admins creates two different admin groups and give them different access levels, perhaps Jira-Administrators and Jira-Sys-Administrators, each of them holding a different Jira permission level, then there will be a few differences in what each of the permission allows the admins to do, but the documentation is not clear enough about that. 
e.g. The only one that presents the Announcement banner matter is the Jira 8.13 [Managing Global Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/managing-global-permissions-1027137822.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAboutJiraSystemAdministratorsandJiraAdministrators] article.
fields.summary: Fix documentation - Permission for Jira Announcement Banner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The browser's performance degrades when a custom field with a large number of options is added to the screen. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a "Select List (cascading)" customfield type with more than 500 options
# For each of the options, create another 100 options.
# Add the customfield to the project's create screen.
# Create issue from the "Create" button from the top bar.

h3. Expected Results

Create issue screen will immediately appear. 

h3. Actual Results 

The browser will display a spinning icon for few minutes and then the create screen will appear. 

h3. Workaround
* Reduce the number of custom field options. 
* Split the options into different custom fields. 

h3. Notes
# After further investigation, we found that the browser is processing each child options. The browser first retrieves all child options, so that when a user later switches back and forth, the browser doesn't have to keep doing more work. In a sense, this is caching all the results ahead of time.
# once the browser retrieves all child options, it has to go through and hide all the child options until the parent is selected.
# All the processing work done by the browser is to hide all the child options until the parent is actually selected. The more options there are, the more the browser has to process.
# All this is on the browser side, but Jira is generating the script that is handled by the browser.
fields.summary: Browser performance degraded when customfield has a large number of customfieldoption.

Jira Custom Field "*Select List (multiple choices)*" with multiple contexts is not sorted alphabetically.

# Create a Jira Custom field, type "Select List (multiple choices)"
# Create 2 contexts for this custom field
# Assign a context to Project A
# Add few options
# Assign the context to Project B
# Add few options
!image-2021-09-15-12-22-48-858.png|thumbnail!
# Ensure you click on "Sort options alphabetically" on both contexts
!image-2021-09-15-12-23-50-210.png|thumbnail!
# Re-index Jira
# Run a JQL to sort issues by Jira custom field
{code:java}
project in ("Project A", "Project B") AND assignee in (currentUser()) ORDER BY "Client Name(s)" ASC
{code}
!image-2021-09-15-12-37-25-157.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The result should be displayed in alphabetical order

h3. Actual Results
When multiple projects are added, results are not displayed in alphabetical order.
!image-2021-09-15-12-39-16-052.png|thumbnail!

!Not sorted.png|thumbnail!

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deadlock occurs when changing the External Directories encryption key and adding/updating the external directory at the same time.

The issue makes all administrative action on external directories (adding new, updating, removing, reordering) impossible until Jira is restarted. (Affects all nodes)

The issue doesn't affect other Jira functionalities like login, viewing issues, viewing user profile, managing users, etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Jira instance with External Directories
 # Change encryption key `crowd.encryption.encryptor.default` via `Advanced Setting` in Jira
 # At the same time as Step 2 try to add a new External Directory to Jira or update existing one
 # Have bad luck

h3. Expected Results

There is no deadlock and Jira work normally.
h3. Actual Results

All administrative actions on external directories freeze until Jira restart.
h3. Workaround

If deadlock already happened then the only solution is to restart the Jira node that is deadlocked. 

Deadlock can be prevented by waiting few minutes after changing the encryption key before doing any changes to external directories.

*Notes*

Each node can be restarted one by one with zero downtime. Just make sure that nobody tries to change external directories during the restart procedure.
fields.summary: Deadlock when changing ExternalDirectories encryption key and adding/updating directory at the same time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the different environments across the various companies using Jira around the world, there are many project roles defined within a jira instance. And projects only use some roles, not all of the available.

The main idea behind this FR, is to consider that a Jira Admin should be able to determine if a Role should be or shouldn't be present/part on a spefict project. Determine if a Role should be or shouldn't be global. 

 

Best regards.
fields.summary: Add the ability to Jira Admin enable/disable Roles according to specific projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently we cannot deactivate users that are listed as the project lead for any archived projects.

It is required to reactivate the project to edit the Project lead, although it would affect reports that uses the Project's Archive Date.

h3. Workaround
Update the Project Lead from Database.
{code}
update project set lead='JIRAUSERxxxx' where pname='ProjectName'
{code}
fields.summary: Change the Project Lead for Archived projects.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We noticed that when using the _"View Workflow"_ option on Issue view, with a small amount of Zoom, Jira will cut out the _"Close"_ option if the page zoom is resized.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Jira Story in full-screen mode (not Issue Detail view)
2. Ensure screen zoom is at 100%
3. Click on (view workflow)
3.1 Should be able to see whole of workflow on screen.
3.2 Close link should be visible bottom right-hand corner
4. Close pop-up.
5. Use Ctrl+Mousewheel to reduce screen zoom Level (able to reproduce by reducing to 80%)
6. Click on (view workflow)
6.1 Pop-up will show the workflow
6.2 Advice message will also appear saying 'The Workflow Designer may not behave correctly at your current browser zoom level, press Ctrl +0 to reset it.
7. Press Ctrl +0
8. Pop-up screen should resize
8.1 Bottom of pop-up now off the bottom of the screen
8.2 Pop-up now bigger than screen.
9. To resolve the situation
9.1 Hold Ctrl and roll mouse-wheel again to reduce zoom.
9.2 Pop-up will re-size on the screen.
9.3 Click close

h3. Expected Results
Page would resize and show the Workflow options.

h3. Actual Results
Page is resized, and the _"Close"_ option is cut out of the Screen, not allowing to close the screen.

h3. Workaround
If the key _"ESC"_ is pressed, the screen is closed and the zoom is set correctly.
fields.summary: View Workflow "Close" option is cut if Zoom page is resized

{panel:title=(i) Bug report moved|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b8daff|titleBGColor=#b8daff|bgColor=#e6f2ff}

h3. Issue Summary
Upgrading SSO for Atlassian Server and Data Center to version 4.2.5 will not provide users with the option to Log in with IDP. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade the SSO for Atlassian Server and Data Center to version 4.2.5
 !image-2021-09-13-17-16-33-830.png|thumbnail! 
 # Access Jira and click on the "Log In" button on the top right
 !image-2021-09-13-17-17-11-140.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
There will be an option to log in with IDP or internal directory 
 !image-2021-09-13-17-14-40-403.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
No longer possible to log in via IDP. Only Product login form option provided. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Downgrade the to SSO for Atlassian Data Center plugin to version 4.2.4

# Go to the manage apps page 
# Select all apps and search for "SSO for Atlassian Data Center"
# Uninstall this app. 
# Download [SSO for Atlassian Server and Data Center version 4.2.4|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/apps/1216096/version/400200420]
# Upload this app from the Manage apps page ( the Upload app button )

Notes
If the Product login form is disabled, the login gadget will not be displayed on the dashboard. However, when clicking on "Log in" it will be visible there but the IDP login option will still not be visible.
fields.summary: Upgrading SSO for Atlassian Data Center plugin breaks SAML log in page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary We can customise the login message via /atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.properties. Customised the message with image (place the image in /images/icons) with HTML tags. The image is displayed accordingly when dashboard is first loaded but the customised message is escaped after the invalid login resulting the HTML tags being ignored. First loaded: !login.png|thumbnail! After invalid login: !login1.png|thumbnail! This is only happening with login gadget, not the login page. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Customise the login message with image HTML tags (placing the image in /images/icons) via /atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.properties. # Restart Jira # Test the login gadget with invalid credentials. h3. Expected Results The image with the customised message is displayed accordingly. h3. Actual Results The HTML tags is escaped and the HTML tags are displayed as it is. h3. Workaround Tracing where the *gadget.login.notmembernotpublic* message is used led us to [login.soy|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/static/dashboarditem/login/login.soy#74,80]: {code:java} {if $isPublicMode}
{getText('gadget.login.notmember', '', getText('gadget.login.notmember.signup'), '')|noAutoescape}
{elseif $adminFormOn}
{getText('gadget.login.notmembernotpublic', getText('common.concepts.contact.administrator', '', ''))|noAutoescape}
{else}
{getText('gadget.login.notmembernotpublic', getText('common.concepts.contact.administrator', '', ''))}
{/if}{code} As we can see, the last message is missing *noAutoescape*. The login.soy is embedded within /atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin-.jar. Follow the below steps to rectify the issue: # [Extract|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/deployment/jar/unpack.html] the {{jira-gadgets-plugin-.jar}} file: {code:java}jar xf jira-gadgets-plugin-8.5.8.jar{code} # Edit /static/dashboarditem/login/login.soy file to include *noAutoescape* with the last getText method: {code:java} {getText('gadget.login.notmembernotpublic', getText('common.concepts.contact.administrator', '', ''))|noAutoescape}{code} # [Create a new JAR|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/deployment/jar/build.html] container after modifying the files and name it the same as the original JAR file (e.g. {{jira-gadgets-plugin-.jar}}).  {code:java} jar cvfm jira-gadgets-plugin-8.5.8.jar META-INF/MANIFEST.MF ./*{code} # Replace the JAR file in /atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins # Restart Jira
fields.summary: Login gadget escapes HTML tags upon invalid login

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a screen is added to the *Create* issue transition in Jira, further attempts to navigate under *Issues > Screens* will result in the page not loading successfully.

(i) Please note there is a different problem with similar symptoms - JRASERVER-72924.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Modify a workflow and add a screen to it under the *Create* issues transition. The screen you add has to be on the first page of the *Issues > Screens* page for this to be reproducible.
 # After publishing the workflow, navigate back to *Issues > Screens*

h3. Expected Results

You can navigate to the page successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The following exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
2021-09-02 10:32:52,800-0500 http-nio-48190-exec-23 ERROR admin 632x1647x1 6gzam0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/screens [c.a.j.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)

fields.description:
It would be useful to have the choice to re-order the list of roles in the drop down when adding users to a role.

The reason for this is that often "Administrators" – typically the first role in the alphabetic list – is too easily selected because it is the first option. This contributes to there being too many administrators of a project.

Issue Duplication:
 # Projects
 # <Choose an applicable project>
 # Project Settings
 # Roles
 # View Project Roles
 # Add users to a role
 # <Choose a user/group to add>
 # Click the down arrow for the list of roles to choose

The list is displayed alphabetically. Would like to have a choice in the order of roles displayed.
fields.summary: Ability to change the order of roles displayed when adding users to a role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue is linked to another issue (e.g. relates to) and you click on the linked issue you will be forwarded to the issue but the space and navigation bar does not change to the new project information. You must refresh the page to see the new information.

This has been reproduced in versions 8.13.5, 8.13.6 and 8.17.0.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access issue with a linked issue.
 # Click to access the linked issue.

h3. Expected Results

After accessing the linked issue page, the sidebar information will be updated automatically.
h3. Actual Results

The linked issue page sidebar will display information from the previous issue.
h3. Workaround

Refreshing the page will update information.
fields.summary: Need to refresh the page when opening the linked issue

fields.description:
As a Jira Admin we need a way to require JQL to meet certain criteria before the can be saved.  We have found that when the project is left off the JQL we have queries searching through 3+ million issues taking upwards of 30s to complete depending on how complex the JQL is. 

 

It would also be nice if we could terminate the JQL if it exceeds a certain threshold of time so that the system does not keep spinning on a poor JQL.
fields.summary: JIRA Admin ability to restrict JQL to meet certain criteria

fields.description:
Feature Request opened from Customer comment about https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-the-attachments-directory-location-for-jira-server-237569020.html:

Symbolic links to fix a hard-coded configuration setting problem introduced in newer version of the product? What is this, 1988? Why even display it as a configuration setting?
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin, I don't want to use symbolic link to be able to save attachments in another location

fields.summary: User requires the First name, Last name and Email address to be encrypted in Jira database to comply with GDPR requirements

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary

The information provided in the *Cluster information in the audit log* section of the documentation [Jira cluster monitoring|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-cluster-monitoring-983794905.html] is incorrect and incomplete:
- *Issue 1*:
-- *Problem*: the page *Jira administration > System > Advanced audit log* mentioned in the 1st step is incorrect (this page does not exist)
-- *Solution*: the correct page should be *Jira administration > System > Audit log*
- *Issue 2*:
-- *Problem*: we mention the following instruction: "The events are logged when you select the Full level of the Global configuration and administration coverage area.". However, this instruction is unclear and incomplete, and does not tell us where to go and which setting to change
-- *Solution*: we need to explain that we need to go first to the page *Jira administration > System > Audit log > ... > Settings* and then set the *Global configuration and administration* coverage area to *Full*
- *Issue 3*:
-- *Problem*: the section *View runtime and system info* located under the section *Cluster information in the audit log* does not have a header font. As a result, it looks like this section is also part of the audit log section, while it has nothing to do with it
-- *Solution*: add the proper header to the section *View runtime and system info*, so that it can be displayed as a proper section

Also, adding a few screenshots would be helpful, so that the customer can see specific examples of what is displayed in the audit logs.

h3. Suggestion

For *Issue 1* and *Issue 2*:
Change the whole *Cluster information in the audit log* section as shown below:
{panel}
To help you manage your cluster, you can also find the information on nodes leaving or joining the cluster in your Audit log.

To be able to record these events in the Audit logs, follow the steps below:
# Go to *Jira administration > System > Audit log > ... > Settings*, set the *Global configuration and administration* coverage area to *Full*, and click on the *Save* button
 !AuditLog_ChangingCoverageToFull.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to *Jira administration > System > Audit log*, and search for the "clustering" keyword to see the logged cluster-related events
 !AuditLog_Example.png|thumbnail! 

We log the following events:
- NodeJoined - a new node has joined the cluster
- NodeReJoined - an existing node was restarted and re-joined the cluster
- NodeLeft - a node received the OFFLINE status
- NodeRemoved - a node was removed from the cluster
 - NodeUpdated - all other cases when existing node was updated
{panel}

For *Issue 3*:
Add the proper header to the section *View runtime and system info*, so that it can be displayed as a proper section
fields.summary: Need to fix the "Cluster information in the audit log" part of the documentation "Jira cluster monitoring"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Allow Jira admins to modify/update user from remote directory if "auto update user attribute when login" is checked with user directory "internal with LDAP authentication"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a user directory of type, "internal with LDAP authentication" in Jira.
 # Check the box for "auto update user attribute when login".
 # Once this done, the user's email cannot be updated by Jira admin from UI.

h3. Requested changes
 # We want the "auto update user attribute when login" works,
 as well as to allow admin is to update user attribute when user is not able to login for long time.
 Reason:
 # We had many case that user does not receive critical Jira email notification, due to the email address change in LDAP, but these user does not login Jira, and we admin is not able to update it.
 # We also have case that, user was disabled in system, and we admin is unable to re-enable them.
fields.summary: Allow Jira admins to modify/update user from remote directory if "auto update user attribute when login" is checked with user directory "internal with LDAP authentication"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue collector not applying default issue security level in a project a person has administrator permissions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
# Create a project and apply an issue security scheme that has administrators/reporter/assignee as the default level
#  Create an issue collector
# Add the tester in the administrators role
#  Make sure administrators role has access to manage issue security level in the permission scheme
# Log an issue via the issue collector as this tester in the administrators role, add your email that exists in jira in the email field
# Default issue security level is not set

h3. Expected Results
The issue created by issue collector should inherit the default issue security level.

h3. Actual Results
The new issue created by issue collector will not have the default issue security level assigned.


h3. Workaround
# Repeat the same process but remove the administrator from the administrators role. In the latter scenario the security level is set as normal.
#  Pre-set the issue security level within the issue collector code on the page where the issue collector is hosted.
fields.summary: Issue collector not applying default issue security level in a project a person has administrator permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JIRA hangs when Edit button is clicked. This happens when all fields are removed from the Edit Screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project
# Go to the project's project administration page > Screens > Click on Edit Issue Screen
# Remove all fields from Edit Issue screen
# Create issue from this project
# Click on Edit button

h3. Expected Results
# Have the same behavior as if the user has no edit permissions in the project permission scheme: No EDIT button and nothing if we use the 'e' shortcut
# it should like transition screen when we do not assign any field in screen, it should pop up a empty screen with "Comment" field.

h3. Actual Results
# JIRA will keep spinning forever and press ESC seems not working.



h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Edit button causes JIRA to hang when Edit issue screen does not contain any field

Like:

*Disable Component - {{PUT /rest/api/2/component/\{id}/disable}}*

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Connection Pool graph only shows statistics for the past 6 hours, hence anything above 6 hours will not be shown.

!Database Monitoring Tool.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow customizable duration for the graph so it can span for a longer time range
fields.summary: Increase time Range of Database Monitoring tool for Connection Pool

fields.description:
Hi team,

According to the [data base encryption KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/encrypting-database-password-975040997.html] Jira supports below database encryption algorithms. Refer [Advanced encryption link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/advanced-encryption-975040999.html] in the same article.
{panel}
AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding
DES/CBC/PKCS5Padding
DESede/CBC/PKCS5Padding
{panel}

Since Jira now supports Postgres 10.x and 11, this request is for support of sha-256 algorithm for Database encryption.
fields.summary: Support for sha-256 database encryption algorithm

Hi,

At present, editing of existing issues is possible only through System>External System Import, which requires Jira admin rights.

It would be very much helpful if it is possible to update existing issues via CSV import without Jira admin rights.
fields.summary: Allow editing of existing issues via CSV import without jira admin rights

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The database latency does affect Jira – high latency would drop the performance, as covered in [Database latency impact on Jira performance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/database-latency-impact-on-jira-performance-1082268864.html]. As an admin, there is no option to monitor database latency natively in Jira.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add round trip time (RTT) to Jira's Database Monitoring page. 
 !dbmonitor.png!
fields.summary: Add round trip time to Jira's Database Monitoring page

And since there is no plugin/add-on/app available in the marketplace for this purpose, and there are multiple browsers that users can work with, and seemingly only Google Chrome offers an add-on for such ability, we raise this suggestion on our customer's behalf.

!Capture (1).JPG|width=449,height=265!

fields.description:
When cloning an issue that has "Issue links" and "external links" (Confluence links,etc), you only have the option to "clone links" that will clone Issue links and external links as well.

We would like to option to exclude external links from being cloned.
fields.summary: Clone issues option to exclude external links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue cards order will be added very differently to the backlog display list depending on how/where issue cards were created.
This behavior is challenging to ensure that the backlog is always in order for at least top items.
Could the Jira project be configured to ONLY add new tickets at the bottom of the backlog as the default way of adding new tickets on the backlog, please?

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: 
If one adds a new ticket from a view other than the board then the new ticket is added to the bottom of the backlog once we navigate there.
 # Step 2:
If one is on the board and creates a new ticket, the new ticket will automatically appear underneath whichever ticket is currently selected.
 # Step 3:
If no ticket is selected on the board and a new ticket is added that ticket will appear at the top of the backlog.

h3. Expected Results
New issue cards should appear at the bottom of the backlog issue list

h3. Actual Results
The new issue card backlog display position will vary on how/where the card was created.


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inconsistent display order in backlog issues.
Provide the ability to rename groups after creation

fields.description:
As per current functionality, if webhook is enabled for the below events on a Project
Issue link Deletion
WorkLog Deletion
Comment Deletion
Issue Deletion
Project Deletion

and the Project is deleted, then webhook is triggered for
Issue link that gets deleted in the Project
WorkLog Deletion that get deleted in the Project
Comment Deletion that gets deleted in the Project
Project Deletion that gets deleted in the Project

but no Webhook gets triggered for Issues that get deleted in the Project.

A webhook should also be triggered for Issues that get deleted in the Project or there should be some config available to enable/disable webhook for individual events in the Project on Project deletion
fields.summary: Webhook should be triggered for - deleted issues in the project when Project is deleted and webhook is enabled for "delete Issue" in that Project

 * Details

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Collapse Description field
 # Try to read/expand it using JAWS

h3. Expected Results

JAWS is aware the field is collapsed and offers the way to expand it.
h3. Actual Results

Field is inaccessible by means of a screen reader.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
The  Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) failure retry feature of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center before version 8.16.0 allows remote attackers who are able to trick a user into retrying a request to bypass CSRF protection and replay a crafted request.

**Affected versions:**

 * version < 8.16.0

**Fixed versions:**

 * 8.16.0
fields.summary: Replay attack via the CSRF failure retry form - CVE-2021-39124

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13659].
  {panel}

When an issue is moved between projects, the original issue key is left unassigned, it is never reused, and exists solely as a searchable item pointing to the new issue key. 
If the issue is subsequently moved back to the original project it is then assigned a new issue key in the project. 
It would make more sense if the original issue key was reassigned to the issue.
* Recently we needed to 'undo' an incorrect move, and users subsequently queried why the number had changed.
fields.summary: Moving an issue back to a previous project SHOULD re-use the 'old' issue key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
API [documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.8/#api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/subtask-moveSubTasks] mentions 'reordering subtasks' as doable with API. The [suggestion ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29933] closed as 'Won't do'. WADL documentation (attached) shows the same - as in doable. 

Documentation needs clarify on the schema:

- From the document 
{quote}
Reorders an issue's subtasks by moving the subtask at index "from" to index "to".
{quote}
Here, it's not sure what is meant by _index from_ to _index to_. The schema doesn't say anything about index or any _from_/_to_.
- Here is the schema for request payload as per the document.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

- The latest API documentation [https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.8/#api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/subtask-getSubTasks] gives only one parameter which doesn't really give option for changing the order:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a Jira instance - version >7.2 and above.
# Create a project, a task and add a few subtasks under that task. 
# Run API with the schema as mentioned above (refer document for more details).

h3. Expected Results
- There's example for other resources in the document. For instance, under api/2/issueLink, you can see an example which is missing in our case (move-subtask). Following is example from issueLink:

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
No example provided in the schema and it will be good have a clarity on _index from_ to _index to_ mentioned in the document.


h3. Workaround

The correct payload structure would be: 
{code:json}
{"original":x,"current":y}
{code}

with the parameters: 
|| original | the "from" position of the subtask |
|| x | the element in an array list | 
|| current | the "to" position of the subtask | 
|| y | the element in an array list |  

For example: 
{code}
{"original":0,"current":10}
{code}
will be the action to move subtask at the top to the 11th on the list
fields.summary: Update Documentation Request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some users with mobility disabilities cannot grip a mouse and they use the keyboard alone to navigate websites.
There is content that is only visible if hovered by the mouse, so keyboard users have no access. Tooltips should be designed to be keyboard-operable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Issue reproduced with both Firefox 91.0.1 (64-bit) and Chrome Version 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (x86_64), 
* Access the Release Page on our jira.atlassian.com: https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/JRASERVER?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin%3Arelease-page&status=unreleased
* Using only the keyboard, press <tab> to reach the Progress Bar for one of the versions, for instance, 8.21.0

h3. Expected Results
* See the tooltip for the version, the same presented when using the mouse hover

h3. Actual Results
* We can not access the progress bar using the keyboard

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessibility - Keyboard users can not access the progress tooltip on the Releases page

fields.description:
Team, the commenting experience has been refreshed as per the 8.17 release notes, and it seems the removal of the *Ability to link to a specific comment "Permalink"* function for comments made *several of users unhappy.*

Tickets may have several comments and a Permalink was an easy shortcut to an specific comments, instead of loosing time looking format comment.

We have researched in our knowledge bases and documentations to understand why this feature has been removed but no former reason was found.

It has been found the same feature issue for *Jira Cloud*, but it seems it has been {color:#57d9a3}*fixed*{color}, but {color:#ff0000}*not yet* {color}for *Jira Server / Data Center.*

This is the ticket where this feature was fixed for *Jira Cloud*. JRACLOUD-70156

Although we have an official workaround for this [*Link to a comment missing after an upgrade*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/link-to-a-comment-missing-after-an-upgrade-1081349970.html], Customers are still asking for this feature to be back.

If we have successfully got this feature back in *Jira Cloud* I'm suggesting an effort to ship this feature back as soon as possible on *Jira Server / Data Center* as well.

Thanks for the attention. 
 Please advise.
fields.summary: Lack of a Permalink feature in the new view in Jira 8.17 and later

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Initially when sidebar loads,

it expands/collapses based on WRM data provider {{sidebar-collapsed-by-default}} value 

but we are seeing different behavior in different browser on bulldog instance
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 *  Go to Issue View Page & Boards section - Reports, Issues, Component
 *  Clear local storage
 *  Reload the page

h3. Actual Results

 Issue View (bulldog instance)
||Chrome||Firefox||Safari||
|Working properly in chrome.
 It is expanded by default| it is getting collapsed|Here, it is getting collapsed as well as expanded after few reload of pages|

  Boards section - Reports, Issues, Component (bulldog instance)
||Chrome||Firefox||Safari||
|Here, PIN sidebar is expanded|Here, it is collapsed|Here, it gets expanded as well as collapsed after few page reloads|
h3. Expected Results

_Collapsed/expanded states_
  
||*Project sidebar behavior*
  ||*Software Boards*
 *Viewport not narrow*
  ||*Other*
 *Viewport not narrow*
  ||*Viewport narrow*
 *(fly-out)*
  ||
|Initial|collapsed by default
 WRM data provider key {{sidebar-collapsed-by-default}} is true|expanded by default
 WRM data provider key {{sidebar-collapsed-by-default}} is undefined|collapsed state only
 window.localStorage['\\{{jira-sidebar-collapsed}}'] is not affected|
|User Actions|window.localStorage['\\{{jira-sidebar-collapsed}}'] = true (collapsed)
 window.localStorage['\\{{jira-sidebar-collapsed}}'] =false (expanded)
 state not maintained from WRM data provider|window.localStorage['\\{{jira-sidebar-collapsed}}'] = true (collapsed)
 window.localStorage['\\{{jira-sidebar-collapsed}}'] =false (expanded)
 state not maintained from WRM data provider|collapsed state only
 window.localStorage['\\{{jira-sidebar-collapsed}}'] is not affected by user actions|

 

 

*Workaround*

the issue doesn’t appear when a user at least interacted with the collapse/expand sidebar feature (so that there’s an explicit value in the storage)
fields.summary: Initial load of project sidebar i.e without user actions ,  different browser have different results on collapsing/expanding of sidebar

fields.description:
Currently, when there is a migration from samAccountName to UserPrincipalName(upn) on the LDAP, a number of functionalities in Jira are broken. Mentions are broken [JRASERVER-63858|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63858], filters that might have hardcoded assignee or reporter or watcher name are broken, causing rapid boards to show poor performance and look up users by email address or display name with costly queries etc.

Modifying a large number of mentions and filters to reflect the email address change from the name change is not a trivial task for customers and involves edits on the database or the XML. The request from this suggestion is to make Jira facilitate the changes to be made after the upn change with a UI or rest endpoint.
fields.summary: Jira should update the users in filters and mentions after migration from samAccountName to UserprinicpalName

fields.description:
As a user, it would be nice to have an option to disable some accessibility features, as this one was released in the 8.14 version:
{quote}
h2. Accessibility improvements when creating issues

We continue the journey to make our products and services more accessible. This time we’ve brushed-up the Create issue flow. You can now navigate seamlessly through the process with a keyboard. The flow is also more screen readers friendly. Here's what we've introduced:

[Improved toolbars|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-14-x-release-notes-1027133861.html#]

It’s much easier now to use toolbars. All elements are fully accessible with a keyboard. Use the Tab key to navigate to every item on a page. We’ve added more descriptive tooltips to some buttons. 



  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/files/1027133861/1027142344/1/1606141816319/ally_toolbar.png!
{quote}

Although I understand that accessibility options are important, for heavy keyboard users, this option is counterproductive.
So I think it would be nice to have the option to disable it individually (by user, not system-wide).

h3. Issue Summary

Issue XML is generated with syntax errors
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Issues > Search for Issues
 # Select Export >XML
 # Copy generated XML file and paste into an XML validator

h3. Expected Results

Syntax to be correct, XML document to clear the validator without issues
h3. Actual Results

Validator returns results like: The reference to entity "XXX" must end with the ';' delimiter.
 Ampersands preceding the referenced "entity" are not encoded correctly and are what is generating syntax errors
h3. Workaround

To pass the XML syntax checker: Edit the XML document to change all ampersands to
{code:java}
&{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Description

In the [Jira Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html] page, we mention that we supported the following Java versions:
{quote}Oracle JRE / JDK:
 - Java 8
 - Java 11

OpenJDK:
 - Java 8
 - Java 11{quote}
So, based on this page, the latest Jira version is formally compatible with any sub version of AdoptOpenJDK 11 (11.0.2, ..., 11.0.8, 11.0.9, etc...).

However, since AdoptOpenJDK is a JDK provided by a 3rd party, Jira can be prone to issues caused by this JDK. For example, we've had 2 bugs that have been reported so far, and which were known to be caused by some sub versions of AdoptOpenJDK 11
 - High CPU usage from IO Dispatcher threads when using Java 11, which is resolved when upgrading AdoptOpenJDK to 11.0.8 or a higher version
 - When Jira is running against Java 11, TLS 1.3 requests can cause httpclient threads to become blocked, which is resolved when upgrading AdoptOpenJDK to 11.0.8 or a higher version

For this reason, it would be great if we could list on the Jira supported page any known issue with some versions of AdoptOpenJDK, so that customers are aware of them before they decide to use Jira with AdoptOpenJDK.
h3. Suggestions

There are a few suggestions we can think of:
h3. Suggestion 1

Add a *known issues* section next to the supported Java versions, listing all the known problems found so far, similarly to what is already done on the [Confluence Supported Platforms page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/supported-platforms-207488198.html].
h3. Suggestion 2

In the documentation [Bundled Tomcat and Java versions in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/bundled-tomcat-and-java-versions-1013854250.html], add a new column *Tested JREs*, similarly to what is done in [Bundled Tomcat and Java versions in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/bundled-tomcat-and-java-versions-1005786018.html], so that our customers know what versions are reliable.
fields.summary: Improve the way we list the supported Java versions for Jira Server / Data Center

However, the fact of being a DC only feature isn't clear on this documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0816/configuring-contexts-and-default-values-for-the-description-field-1063164490.html
fields.summary: Update documentation - Configuring contexts and default values for the Description field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Editing a Jira version picker custom field modifies the original order of the versions and the Change History registers an Edit event, even though values were changed, what can be so confusing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type Jira Version Picker and add it to the corresponding screens.
 # Create 4 versions/releases in the project and release two of them ( v1-unreleased, v2-released, v3-unreleased, v4-released)
 # Create an issue and set the custom version field to versions: “v1,v2,v3,v4”
 # In the issue view screen the versions show as: “v1, v2, v3, v4".
 # In the issue edit screen the versions show as: “v4, v2, v1, v3”.
 # Change some other field, eg Priority, and save the issue.

h3. Expected Results

In the Edit issue screen, the field should show the values in the same order they were added when fulfilling the field from the Create issue screen. And the Change History shouldn't register any Edit event, as no values are changed. 
h3. Actual Results

The Change History shows edits to both Priority and the custom version field - even though the custom version field has not been changed.
h3. Workaround

Unknown
fields.summary: Editing a Jira version picker custom field modifies the original order of the versions and the Change History registers an Edit event, even though values weren't changed

fields.description:
Reordering subtasks cause issue links to change. Issue links have sequence fields which contains the order of subtasks. When a subtask is reordered, there is no {{IssueChangedEvent}} being fired, which means apps and customizations cannot keep track of subtasks being reordered.

Suggestion: whenever a subtask is reordered, fire {{IssueChangedEvent}}.
fields.summary: Reordering subtasks should fire an IssueChangedEvent

fields.description:

 Image attached for a better view of the idea:

!Screen Shot 2021-08-27 at 11.06.04.png|width=207,height=189!

fields.description:
Users with motorial disabilities can not use the keyboard to reach editable fields easily as the "pencil" icon used to make the field editable is only reached using mouse hover.  
Fields: 
* Issue Type
* Summary
* Description
* Priority
* Component/s
* Sprint
* Affects Version/s
* Fix Version/s

For these users, they need to:
* Press <Edit>  button to open the edit dialog OR
* Use the keyboard shortcut <e> to open the edit dialog OR
* Use the keyboard Search Field, available at the <,> keyboard shortcut, search for the field, select, provide the value. 
** Exception for this is the keyboard shortcut for Assignee (<a> or <i>) and Labels <l>

We would like to have a keyboard shortcut to reach these fields using the keyboard directly. 
Some options:
* The pencil button could be reachable using the keyboard;
* Add direct access to the fields (as exists for Assignee and Labels);
* Create a single "pencil" keyboard shortcut that would make all the editable fields (as Summary, Description, etc) available for edition at a glance.
fields.summary: Accessibility - As a keyboard user I would like to be able to reach the editable issue fields using the keyboard

fields.description:

* Press tab to move around the objects
* Press Arrow down or Arrow Up to scroll down the page and read all the available options
 
h3. Expected Results
* Arrow up/down scrolls the page

h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround
No workarounds available
fields.summary: Accessibility - The scrollbar at the Keyboard Shortcuts dialog cannot be accessed by keyboard users

Regards,

Bhuvanesh Gomase

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the latest Jira releases, even with its default configuration that should keep *Velocity caching enabled* in order to prevent changes to the velocity templates from being applied without a full restart of a Jira instance, the application implements the changes immediately as if this feature was *disabled*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new environment.
 # Configure its outgoing mail features.
 # Edit the following file: {{<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/html/issuecreated.vm}} by including text at the end of it.
 # Without restarting your instance, create an issue (but first, you must select the *Notify Me* option in your personal profile so that you will receive the notification).


h3. Expected Results

*  As your Jira instance was not restarted the changes to the velocity templates should not be implemented by Jira, due to the Velocity Caching feature.

h3. Actual Results

* The changes are implemented immediately as if the *Velocity Caching* feature was disabled through the *velocity.properties* file. You can refer to the screenshot below:

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Velocity Caching is disabled contradicting the settings configured in the velocity.properties file
Allow indexing for fields larger than 32766 characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using webhooks for issuelink related actions, we could see that the payload is quite minimal and doesn't include many information. For instance, it doesn't provide a self URL which makes it difficult to get back to the JIRA server from which it was triggered.

This is an example of the payload from an issuelink created webhook:
 !Issuelink_created.png|width=323,height=194! 
  

Testing the same webhook for issue created webhook, we could see that it includes a self URL:
 !issue_created.png|width=306,height=174!
h3. Workaround

If you need to access the issues involved in the issuelink webhook, you should still be able to see what issue it's linked form, then do issue functions on them by adding your Jira base URL and the REST calls listed here for issues - [Jira server REST APIs - Issue|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.13.1/#api/2/issue]
 !issuelinkjson.png|width=259,height=114!
fields.summary: Improve the webhook payload for the issuelink related actions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching JQL issues using != on project categories, the result set omits projects that don't have categories

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3 projects, Project A, Project B, Project C
 # Set Project A's project category to Category A. Set Project C's category to Category C. Leave project B with no project category. 
 # Perform a JQL search
{code}
category != "Category A"
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Issues from Project B and C should show up. 

h3. Actual Results
Only issues from Project C show up. Project B issues are omitted. 

h3. Workaround
Give a default / misc project to uncategorised projects
fields.summary: JQL != searches don't include projects with no categories set

fields.description:
Currently there's no coverage level on the Audit Log that includes Jira System settings changes.

Example: 
Changing the Jira mode from "Private" to "Public" isn't logged.
fields.summary: Ability to add system settings changes to the Audit Log

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Plugins {{jar}} files that are used by Jira Data Center are located in {{<jira-shared-home>/plugins/installed-plugins}} folder.
The {{jar}} files located there are copied to each node during startup to the plugins cache.

During [zero downtime upgrades (ZDU)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-data-center-with-zero-downtime-938846953.html], Jira won't delete old files from the {{<jira-shared-home>/plugins/installed-plugins}}, since other nodes may still use these files.
During startup you may notice entries in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} similar to the below:
{code}
2021-08-17 17:01:20,480-0300 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.j.application.install.PluginBundleInstaller] Application plugin '/shared-home/plugins/installed-plugins/jira-transition-triggers-plugin-8.5.9.jar' is currently locked by an in-progress Zero Downtime Upgrade, skipping clean up of old version
{code}

If you rely on ZDU since it was introduced, you may have more than 5 {{jar}} files of the same plugin on {{<jira-shared-home>/plugins/installed-plugins}} which are copied to each node during startup.

h3. Suggested Solution
On ZDU, upgrade tasks are executed after all nodes are on the target version.
There should be an upgrade task to delete old files from {{<jira-shared-home>/plugins/installed-plugins}}, keeping only current ones.

h3. Workaround
Review files {{<jira-shared-home>/plugins/installed-plugins}} folder and manually delete the old (duplicates) {{jar}} files.
Perform a rolling restart, clearing the plugins cache on each node.
{quote}
Run the following on each node.
# Stop Jira following your standard procedure.
# Delete the following folders.
{code}
<jira-local-home>/plugins/.bundled-plugins
<jira-local-home>/plugins/.osgi-plugins
{code}
# Start Jira following your standard procedure.
{quote}
fields.summary: Jira should remove old jar files of plugins from the shared home as part of an upgrade task when using ZDU

fields.description:
The Editor plugin in Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center before version 8.5.18, from 8.6.0 before 8.13.10, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.18.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the handling of supplied content such as from a PDF when pasted into a field such as the description field.



The affected versions are before version 8.5.18, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.10, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.18.2.

**Affected versions:**

 * version < 8.5.18
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.10
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.18.2

**Fixed versions:**

 * 8.5.18
 * 8.13.10
 * 8.18.2
 * 8.19.0
fields.summary: Self-xss via copying content from a PDF - CVE-2021-39111

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow authenticated remote attackers to enumerate the keys of private Jira projects via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in the /rest/api/latest/projectvalidate/key endpoint.

The affected versions are before version 8.5.18, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.10, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.18.2.

**Affected versions:**

 * version < 8.5.18
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.10
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.18.2

**Fixed versions:**

 * 8.5.18
 * 8.13.10
 * 8.18.2
fields.summary: Project key enumeration via the /rest/api/latest/projectvalidate/key endpoint - CVE-2021-39121

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a comment on a new browser tab and making the text area bigger, the bottom bar will overlap with the Save/Cancel options.

Issue has been reproduced on versions 8.17.0 and 8.17.1. This issue did not happen on an older version we tested (8.11.0).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click to *edit* a comment in a new tab.
 # On the new tab, by making the text area bigger, the bottom bar will overlap with the Save/Cancel options.

h3. Expected Results

Screen will adjust to the text area size accordingly.
h3. Actual Results

See attachment.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. This issue does not happen if you edit the comment on the same tab.
fields.summary: Bottom bar will overlap options when editing comment in new tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User cannot download the text format files directly.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a text format file at Attachments tab in Jira issue
 # User can attach many files in one issue
 # On the Attachments tab, click one file in text format

 
h3. Actual Result

The text format file is not download, but a preview appears in the same browser window. User must right-click on the file to select "Save Link As ..." for download the file.

 
h3. Expected Result

User should be able to choose the option to force download an attachment instead of showing the preview.
fields.summary: Force download an attachment instead of showing the preview

fields.description:
I have an existing field called "total story points" which is not used by all projects in my Jira instance, might be many of my users does not aware of it. so I want to make an announcement banner for my customer but how I can do it more effectively.



I want some suggestions or recommendations on it. What type of announcement it will fall?
Few announcements heading will be Tips & tricks and few might be Planned Maintenance.

 

 

What can be the heading and how effectively I can convey it. Mainly the best practices.
fields.summary: I want an suggestion on the Announcement banner
